meanings.definition: An incorrect or inaccurate citation of a source.
meanings.sent1: The student's miscitation of the book led to confusion in the class.
meanings.sent2: The professor noticed a miscitation in the research paper.
meanings.sent3: The miscitation in the bibliography made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her miscitation was like a wrong turn on a map, leading to a dead end.
meanings.sent5: The miscitation stood out like a red flag in the text.

meanings.sent1: Please do not miscitation the author's work in your essay.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally miscitationed the statistics in his presentation.
meanings.sent3: She tends to miscitation when rushing to finish her assignments.
meanings.sent4: His habit of miscitationing facts made him unreliable in debates.
meanings.sent5: The journalist's miscitation of the data caused a stir in the community.
